case_vignette: A 49-year-old man comes to the physician because of tender, red nodules that appeared on his chest 3 days ago. Three weeks ago, he had similar symptoms in his right lower limb and another episode in his left foot; both episodes resolved spontaneously. He also has diarrhea and has had a poor appetite for 1 month. He has a history of dry cough and joint pain, for which he takes albuterol and aspirin as needed. He has smoked 2 packs of cigarettes daily for 15 years. He does not drink alcohol. Physical examination shows a linear, erythematous lesion on the right anterior chest wall, through which a cord-like structure can be palpated. The lungs are clear to auscultation. The abdomen is soft, nontender, and non-distended. Examination of the legs is normal. An ultrasound of the legs shows no abnormalities.
question: Which  is the most appropriate next step in diagnosis of the underlying condition?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.

I have tender, red bumps on my chest that showed up 3 days ago.

Yes, three weeks ago I had similar sore, red bumps on my right lower limb and my left foot.
Have you experienced any fevers or chills recently?
No, I haven't had any fevers or chills.
Have you recently been in wooded or grassy areas, or engaged in outdoor activities?
The case vignette doesn't mention any recent activities like that.
Do you have a history of any medical conditions or are you taking any medications?
I have a history of dry cough and joint pain, and I use albuterol and aspirin when needed.
Is there any history of similar skin rashes in your family?
The case vignette does not provide information about my family history.

Understood. Thank you for your cooperation. Based on the information provided, I suspect you may have **Lyme disease**.

**Final Diagnosis:** Lyme disease
